Seems to be unrelated to having the source missing.
When I click on the ViewsPlugin stack frame, for which source is displayed, it 
still takes a while and generates more timeouts in the log.
Is this something that you can reproduce?
Sounds like you have a target which has stopped/slowed down in responding.

When I tried resuming, I got a Resume Failed error dialog.  
Reason: Exceptions occurred attempting to resume.

It took 30 seconds or so for the dialog's details button to become responsive.
Details:
  org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException occurred resuming thread.

I have a reproduceable case:
- self-hosting workspace with org.eclipse.ui module in source, rest in binary
- target workspace has small project, in Java perspective, with Java editor 
open (it's important that JDT be activated)
- set breakpoint in org.eclipse.ui.views.ViewsPlugin's constructor
- debug target
- hits breakpoint, shows source for it, all is well
- select top several stack frames, all is well
- log is empty
- scroll down in the stack and select JavaPlugin.startup()
- it hangs for 10-12 secs, then shows the source
- log now has 4 TimeoutExceptions with different MESSAGEs (see below)
- now, clicking on other stack frames (even those that worked before) 
generates timeouts

I am unable to receate the timeout problem with the same VM, and breakpoint in 
the same location. We have seen cases where a target VM seems to stop 
responding, but we do not know why or how to reproduce it.

The problem with the UI blocking is a known issue (can't find the bug right 
now), that we should address post 2.1. The problem is that we attempt to 
generate labels for stack frames (and other debug elements) in the UI thread, 
which may require communication with the target VM (which can have delay and 
timeouts).
Marking as later to address the issue of JDI communications in the UI thread.

Closing - we are addressing the background content in another feature request 
(bug 44724). Background labels are already supported.
